info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cabarrus, southeastern Mecklenburg, southeastern Rowan and northwestern Union Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 739 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Uptown Charlotte, or near South Charlotte, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Concord, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Pineville and Harrisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for the Piedmont of North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina.
